name: rustily
content:
rustily adverb
(METAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is covered in rust (= a reddish-brown substance that forms on the surface of iron and steel as a result of reacting with air and water), or as if covered in rust: The springs in the chair creaked rustily as I sat down. I heard the sound of a key turning rustily in the lock.
More examplesFewer examplesAn old boat chugged rustily downriver.The door creaked rustily on its hinges when he pushed it.The leaves danced rustily in the autumn sunshine.

rustily adverb
(NEEDING PRACTICE)
in a way that shows that something or someone needs more practice: The team started off rustily, but improved as they got into the game. We should expect our muscles to work rustily for a while.
More examplesFewer examplesShe often starts these tournaments rustily.He spoke rustily, his words coming slowly and with difficulty at first.
